statement.p: In the figure below, the angles that appear to be right angles are in fact right angles. Lengths in the figure are given in units of feet.

Image DescriptionA closed shape with five straight sides, with its interior shaded, where four of its five sides are either horizontal or vertical. Beginning at the bottom right corner and moving straight up, the path around the shape starts with a side that is labeled 37 feet, then moving to the left, a side is labeled 16 feet, then moving diagonally down and left, a side is labeled 20 feet, then moving straight down, a side is unlabeled, and finally moving to the right, a side is labeled 32 feet, connecting back to the original starting point at bottom right.
What is the area of the shaded shape? Give your answer as a decimal number, and then choose the correct units from the dropdown menu.
